metadata.Title: CVE-2017-10663 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The sanity_check_ckpt function in fs/f2fs/super.c in the Linux kernelbefore 4.12.4 does not validate the blkoff and segno arrays, which allowslocal users to gain privileges via unspecified vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-10663` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-96.119
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-96.119
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-96.119
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1074-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1074.82
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1076-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1076.81
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1035.44
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.10.0-38.42~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.10.0-38.42~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.10.0-38.42~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1031-gke - 4.4.0-1031.31
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1031-gke - 4.4.0-1031.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.13.0-1005.7
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.10.0-1008.8
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1007.12
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.13.0-1008-oem - 4.13.0-1008.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-96.119').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1074.82').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1076.81').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1035.44').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-38.42~16.04.1').
linux-gke package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1031.31').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1005.7').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1008.8').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1007.12').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-oem package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1008.9').
